column3: in the case of families who need actual subsistence
column4: of putting them on the dole or putting them to work. They do not want to go on the dole
column5: and they are one thousand percent right. We agree
column7: that we must put them to work for a decent wage
column8: and when we reach that decision we kill two birds with one stone
column9: because these families will earn enough by working not only to subsist themselves
column10: but to buy food for their stock
column11: and seed for next year's planting. Into this scheme of things there fit of course the government lending agencies which next year
column13: will help with production loans.Every Governor with whom I have talked is in full accord with this program of doing work for these farm families
column14: just as every Governor agrees that the individual states will take care of their unemployable but that the cost of employing those who are entirely able and willing to work must be borne by the Federal Government.
